Package se.liu.ida.paperio

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • se.liu.ida.paperio.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The board class is the class responsible for main game logic. This class initializes the tile grid, players and keeps track of them. Board is also specifies key bindings, fills enclosed areas and keeps track of a timer to tick through game logic. Board draws the live scoreboard but uses one or two Painter:s to draw the game area and players on it.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      int areaHeight,
      int areaWidth,
      int gameSpeed,
      int botNumber)
        Creates board for singleplayer
        Parameters:
        actionListener - listener for key presses and state updates
        p1name - name of player
        areaHeight - height of game area
        areaWidth - width of game area
        gameSpeed - game speed between 1 and 5, 5 being the fastest
        botNumber - number of bots to have in game

      • Board

      int gameSpeed,
      int botNumber)

        Parameters:
        actionListener - listener for key presses and state updates
        p1name - name of player 1
        p2name - name of player 2
        areaHeight - height of game area
        areaWidth - width of game area
        gameSpeed - game speed between 1 and 5, 5 being the fastest
        botNumber - number of bots to have in game

      • fillEnclosure

        private void fillEnclosure​(Player player)
        After a player has traveled out to enclose an area the area needs to be filled. This method depends on that the Player.contestedToOwned() method has been called. The method works by doing a depth first search from each tile adjacent to a tile owned by the player sent as parameter. If the DFS algorithm finds a boundary we know it is not enclosed and should not be filled. The boundary is the smallest rectangle surrounding all owned tiles by the player to minimize cost of method. If the DFS can't find the boundary or if the one the DFS starts on we know it should be filled.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose enclosure to be filled

      • setPaused

        void setPaused​(java.lang.Boolean b)
        Set board to paused mode, meaning logic and graphics are not updated
        Parameters:
        b - True if game should be paused, false otherwise
